meanings.definition: The body of law derived from judicial decisions, rather than from statutes or constitutions.
meanings.sent1: Studying caselaws helps lawyers understand how judges interpret the law.
meanings.sent2: Legal scholars often refer to caselaws when analyzing court rulings.
meanings.sent3: The caselaws were so old that they seemed like ancient stories from a legal library.
meanings.sent4: In the world of law, caselaws are like the building blocks of justice.
meanings.sent5: The importance of caselaws cannot be overstated in the legal system.

meanings.definition: The collection of past legal decisions that form the basis of common law.
meanings.sent1: Caselaws provide a historical record of legal precedents.
meanings.sent2: Judges often rely on caselaws to make fair and consistent decisions.
meanings.sent3: The caselaws were stacked high on the shelves of the law library.
meanings.sent4: To understand common law, one must delve into the world of caselaws.
meanings.sent5: The richness of caselaws reflects the evolution of legal principles.
